Triangle A: 13 x 13,5cm / 5 x 5,3”
Triangle B: 13 x 8 cm / 5 x 3,14”
Triangle C: 13 x 10,5 cm / 5 x 4”

instructions.as_text:
All triangles starts the same way:
Cast on 30 sts. Row 1: Knit all. Row 2: Slip first st purlwise without knitting it, keep the yarn in front of work. Knit until 1 st remains. Slip the last st purlwise without knitting it,keep the yarn in front of work. Row 3: K2, **Yo, K2tog, K1** repeat ** ** until the end of the row. Row 4: Slip first st purlwise without knitting it, keep the yarn in front of work. Purl until 1 st remains. Slip the last st purlwise without knitting it,keep the yarn in front of work.
Row 5: Knit all sts.
Row 6: Slip first st purlwise without knitting it, keep the yarn in front of work. Knit until 1 st remains. Slip the last st purlwise without knitting it,keep the yarn in front of work.
Triangle A - Bigger garter stitch triangle : Row 7: K2, Skp, Knit until 4 sts remain. K2tog, K2.
Row 8: Slip first and the last st purlwise without knitting it, keep the yarn in front of work. Knit all rest sts.
Row 9: Knit all
Row 10: Slip first and the last st purlwise without knitting it, keep the yarn in front of work. Knit all rest sts.
Repeat Rows 7-10 until there are 6 sts remaining after Row 10: Right side: K1, Skp, K2tog, K1.
Wrong side: Slip first and the last st purlwise without knitting it, keep the yarn in front of work. Knit all rest sts. Right side: Skp, K2tog.
Wrong side: K2tog. Cut yarn and weave the ends.
Triangle B - Smaller garter stitch triangle :
Row 7: K2, Skp, Knit until 4 sts remain. K2tog, K2.
Row 8: Slip first and the last st purlwise without knitting it, keep the yarn in front of work. Knit all rest sts. Repeat Rows 7 and 8 until there are 6 sts remaining after Row 8: Right side: K1, Skp, K2tog, K1.
Wrong side: Slip first and the last st purlwise without knitting it, keep the yarn in front of work. Knit all rest sts. Right side: Skp, K2tog.
Wrong side: K2tog. Cut yarn and weave the ends.
Triangle C - Stockinette stitch triangle : Row 7: K2, Skp, Knit until 4 sts remain. K2tog, K2.
Row 8: Slip first st purlwise without knitting it, keep the yarn in front of work. K2, purl until 3 sts remain. K2, Slip the last st purlwise without knitting it, keep the yarn in front of work. Repeat Rows 7 and 8 until there are 6 sts remaining after Row 8: Right side: K1, Skp, K2tog, K1.
Wrong side: Slip first and the last st purlwise without knitting it, keep the yarn in front of work. Knit all rest sts. Right side: Skp, K2tog.
Wrong side: K2tog. Cut yarn and weave the ends.
Color variations:
Triangle with horizontal lines has been knitted using Triangle A pattern. With color A knit the starting section. After that knit with color B the rows 7-8 and with color A the rows 9-10. Continue switching colors until the tip of the triangle.
Triangle with vertical lines has been knitted using Triangle C pattern. With color A knit the starting section. Knit according to the pattern using color A for the first and last three sts of the row and altering color A and B every other st in the middle part. Remember to knit with the same color on both the right and wrong side.
Create as many triangles as you like and play with color. Pull string through the holes and there you have it!

text.full_text:
This pattern includes instructions for three different sizes of triangles for decorative bunting.
Triangles A and B are knitted in garter stitch and triangle C is knitted in stockinette stitch.
All triangles are knitted flat from top to triangle’s tip. And they all start the same way with the same stitch count and create the holes for the string.
Note that the final size of each triangle is affected by the yarn weight.

Size:
Triangle A: 13 x 13,5cm / 5 x 5,3”
Triangle B: 13 x 8 cm / 5 x 3,14”
Triangle C: 13 x 10,5 cm / 5 x 4”

Needles:
4 mm / 6 US DPN

Yarn:
Any scrap yarn in DK / Worsted weight wool / mixed wool
6-10 g per triangle
100 g = 200-230m / 219-252 yds

Gauge
22 sts, 44 rows, garter stitch = 10 x 10 cm / 4 x 4”
22 sts, 34 rows stockinette stitch = 10 x 10 cm / 4 x 4”

Required Skills:
Cast on, purls and knits,
yarn over, decreases: skp and 2tog, bind off.
